meanings.definition: The first or leading position in a particular field or activity.
meanings.sent1: In the school play, the role of the queen was played by one of the premiers.
meanings.sent2: The premiers of the soccer team are always the most skilled players.
meanings.sent3: At the talent show, the premiers of the dance competition wowed the audience with their performance.
meanings.sent4: The artist's masterpiece held the premiers of the art exhibition captive with its beauty.
meanings.sent5: Being the premiers in the science fair, they proudly displayed their winning project.

meanings.definition: A prime minister or head of government in certain countries.
meanings.sent1: The premiers of the neighboring countries met to discuss trade agreements.
meanings.sent2: The premiers of the coalition government worked together to address the nation's issues.
meanings.sent3: During the summit, the premiers shared their plans for economic growth.
meanings.sent4: The premiers of the alliance negotiated a peace treaty to end the conflict.
meanings.sent5: The premiers of the parliament debated the new legislation in a heated session.

meanings.definition: To present or introduce for the first time.
meanings.sent1: The company premiers its latest product at the tech expo.
meanings.sent2: The director premiers the film at the prestigious film festival.
meanings.sent3: The magician premiers his new trick to an amazed audience.
meanings.sent4: The author premiers her book at the book signing event.
meanings.sent5: The chef premiers a new dish on the menu, delighting customers with its flavors.
